title: Demands of Nessus
subtitle: Choose one ally you can see within 30 feet.
That creature loses 10 hit points, and you regain
the same number of hitpoints.

title: Path of the Cheaters
subtitle: Choose one ally you can see within 30 feet.
Until the start of that creature's next turn, you gain advantage on all ability checks and
attack rolls, while the chosen ally suffers disadvantage on all ability checks,
attack rolls, and saving throws.
cards.description: Yep, there is **no** advantage on saving throws for you!

title: Vexing Escape
subtitle: When you take damage, reduce that damage to 0 and
teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

title: Loyalty beyond Death
subtitle: When an ally you can see is reduced to 0 hit points, that ally is instead
reduced to 1 hit point and gains temporary hit points equal to your
Charisma score + half your number of Hit Dice.

title: Crushing Blow
subtitle: You gain a bonus to the damage roll of your next melee weapon attack
equal to your Strength modifier (minimum of +1).

title: Step into Shadows
subtitle: You, along with anything you are wearing and carrying,
magically become invisible until the end of your next turn.

title: Spell Shield
subtitle: Reroll one failed saving throw against a spell or magical effect.

title: Fiery Soul
subtitle: You gain resistance to fire damage. If you drop to 0 hit points within
the next minute, flames shoot out from you to shield you;
each creature within 10 feet of you take fire damage
equal to your number of Hit Dice.
cards.description: The resistance only lasts for one minute.

title: Unerring Tracker
subtitle: You create a psychic link with one creature you can see.
For the next hour, as a bonus action you learn the current distance
and direction to the target if it is on the same plane of existence.

title: Labyrinthine Recall
subtitle: You can perfectly recall one path you have traveled.

title: Serpentine Reaction
subtitle: Take one extra reaction this round.
This reaction can only be used to make an opportunity attack.
